column4: anyone know why samba cant handle shared folders from an external firewire hard drive>
what filesystem? this works for a 160G ext3 external firewire partition here...
its a fat32 fs on the external
ours mountable by nfs, smb.
exactly what's the problem?
hm.. the linux-side rights on the folder are ok?
ls -ld  /media/sda1/folder
looks like chmod on the firewire folder didn't work,   ls -ld shows no change! yikes
hmm. but it has been mounted by pmount... so no fstab entry...
do you think i can make a symbolic link to the folder ?
I think I would umount the partition, create a mountpoint (/mnt/something) and remount it by hand.
you could make a symlink, but that would not help you. as symlinks' filemodes are not looked at.
sudo lsof /media/sda1 shows the processes that are using the partition.
stop those processes, and it ain't busy anymore.
kill that famd instance.
I'd first create the mountpoint, and try the mount by hand.
mkdir /mnt/fw; mount -t vfat -o  /mnt/fw /dev/sda1
then ls -ld /mnt/fw to see if the modes look better.
im trying to 'sudo mount -t vfat -o /media/hermes /dev/sda1
I wouldnt create the mountpoint in /media...
you can now put a line in fstab to have your drive mounted at boot time.
should the umask option have a value for it?
default should do.
